title: 109_hr5881
content: The Act titled "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" allows certain military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Act allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. Amendments include extending concurrent receipt authority and repealing the phase-in of concurrent receipt. Clerical amendments are also made to section 1414 of title 10, United States Code. The Act allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. Amendments include extending concurrent receipt authority and repealing the phase-in of concurrent receipt. Clerical amendments are also made to section 1414 of title 10, United States Code, specifically regarding veterans' disability compensation. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The effective date for these amendments is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, coordination of service eligibility for combat-related special compensation and concurrent receipt is addressed in Section 3. The eligibility criteria for TERA retirees have been amended to include those entitled to retired pay with a combat-related disability. Amendments have been made to standardize similar provisions in the legislation. The eligibility criteria for TERA retirees have been amended to include individuals entitled to retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. A qualified retiree is defined as a member or former member of the uniformed services entitled to retired pay. The eligibility criteria for TERA retirees have been amended to include individuals entitled to retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. A qualified retiree is defined as a member or former member of the uniformed services entitled to retired pay, with specific rules for Chapter 61 disability retirees. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act and will apply to payments for months starting on or after that date.
